question.name: 3.4.1.3 Introduction no solution
question.questiontext:
Equations with no solution

On occasions we may encounter a pair of simultaneous equations which have no solution. Consider the following example.

Example

Show that the following pair of simultaneous equations have no solution.

\(10x - 2y = -3\)   (9)

\(-5x + y = 1\)   (10)

Solution

Leaving equation (9) unaltered and multiplying equation (10) by 2 we find

\(10x - 2y = -3\)

\(-10x + 2y = 2\)

Adding these equations to eliminate \(x\) we find that \(y\) is eliminated as well:

\(10x - 2y = -3\)

\(-10x + 2y = 2\)   Add

\(0x + 0y = -1\)

The last line '\(0=-1\)' is clearly nonsense.

We say that Equations (9) and (10) are inconsistent and they have no solution.
